dialogues.text: Ma and Jack come into the bathroom. Ma throws Jack's underpants in the trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's waste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get new ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Sunday Treat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are going to be so many treats, not just on Sundays. Jack looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the bath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a shower instead.   Splashier. Ma notices a large mirror. This is the first time she's s herself properly in 7 years. She studies herself - bares teeth. She points out their reflections to Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, look. It's us. This is the first time Jack has ever properly seen himsel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma, will he find us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he will never, ever come again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma and Jack are in the shower. Jack is pressed to the doo as far away as possible from the powerful jet of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bath before Bed. She can't hear him over the noise of the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bath before Bed, that's the rule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There aren't any rules now, Jack. We can do what we like! Jack is unnerved by all this. Ma groans with pleasure as she lets the water hit the bac her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hurting? Ma laughs. Jack edges into the water and she washes him w a hand towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both in robes with wet hair. While Ma looks out the windo Jack noses around the room taking in the strange experien of an unknown space. He opens a drawer, then another. Emp A very light tap at the door which only Jack hears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door's ticking. The door opens a little. Ma jumps. Jack hides behind his mother as a man's head - wearing a surgical mask - appear around the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello there, I hear we're all woken up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Jack's buries his head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's OK, Jack. DR. MITTAL (thirties/forties) come further into the room. nurse pushes in a breakfast trolly then leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there, Jack. I'm Dr. Mittal. You were asleep when I cam in this morning. Jack won't make eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be hungry? No answer. Dr. Mittal moves the breakfast trolley in fron Ma and Jack. Ma removes the plastic domed lids and foil. stares at the strange food. He runs his finger around the BLUE RIM OF HIS PLATE and looks at it to see if the color come off. Ma eats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I have some things for you both. He hands 2 pairs of sunglasses to Ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may find it more comfortable to wear these if you go outside. Some sunscreen. Holding up a surgical mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Jack.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that really necessary? DR. MITTAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of germs in the air to get used to. (taking out some pills)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My colleague has prescribed these for the pain in your wrist until we can schedule a surgery. (handing over a last bottle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And something to help you sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Thanks. (to Jack who is still playing with his food)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try it, it's delicioso. Jack's not convinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you thought any more about what we discussed this morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the offer but we're going to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know my view. After what you've experienced, and to assess Jack properly. And just to soften the transition -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happened to Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand, but even at a cognitive-sensory level - depth perception, auditory processing ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's OK, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most important thing you did was to get him out while he's still plastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to Ma)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not plastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says he's real, not plastic. Mittal laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't argue with that, Jack. Real and very brave.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We hear voices arguing outside the door. One voice cuts through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh for God's sake ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can talk about this again later. It sounds like you have more important things to do right now. The door opens and Nancy enters (we met her briefly in th emergency room) carrying an overnight bag. She is followe a man in his sixties, rumpled from travel. This is ROBERT Ma's father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My darling. They hug, the masks are quickly discarded. Dr. Mittal wat from the back of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We couldn't wait any longer.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jack, forgotten, is frightened by what he sees. He curls Eventually, Ma notices him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, Jack it's OK. This is your Grandma and Grandpa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Jack. Jack hides his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's OK. Thanks for saving my little girl, Jack. Robert tries to smile but he is very uneasy around Jack. Nancy lifts the small bag she brought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope I didn't forget anything. I'm sure I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hospital roof garden. Jack sticks close to Ma. She is dre in track-suit bottoms and her old warm winter coat. Jack pajamas under his robe and a warm coat which doesn't quit fit. Ma has a pair of her old boots on, Jack has trainers They wear tinted glasses against the brightness of the da Jack is a strange sight, the part of his face not covered his mask (the others are unmasked) or woollen hat is smea in heavy sun screen. They sit with Robert and Nancy. Nanc smokes a slim cigarette. Jack watches her cigarette for a while, then his attention is snagged by a nurse pushing a old woman in a wheelchair. He is also fascinated by the s reflected in the mirrored glass of the building. Ma runs her hand along her coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off Ma's clothes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kept everything. Jack is finding his shoes - the first he's ever worn - irritating. He starts to take them off.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave them, Jack, you'll get used to them. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hug again. Letting go at last they smile at each oth for a long moment. We feel a history of great closeness between them. Ma wipes away her tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what's in Michigan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert and Nancy exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sensing something) OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working out of the Grand Rapids office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I live there now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Sweetie... There have been a lot of changes in our lives since you've been gone. Your dad and I... losing you, was very hard on us. And he and I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had to go our different ways. It was what we had to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack doesn't understand any of this but hates the tension

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. This is not what I thought was happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father felt we had to accept that you were...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops herself. Robert suppresses his anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People deal with things in their own way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you'd come home one day. They sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry, I didn't know how to tell you. They said we should talk to you together. Nancy is upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor mentioned this other place where they could help you, because it's hard, you know, to suddenly -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has no idea what we've been through. Nothing could compare to that. Robert and Nancy sit with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him we're going home. (to Nancy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless, you'd prefer us ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Again a look passes between Robert and Nancy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, there's something else I have to tell you. After your father and I separated I got close to someone else. Actually someone you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, this is a lot of stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it is. Nancy is upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo's a good guy. Your mother is much happier. It's a good thing. Jack tugs at Ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a hint of irritation)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, Jack? But he won't say it loud and she has to lean down to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too big here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want some. He starts to burrow under her coat. Robert is horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What .. what's he doing? Ma is surprised by her father's reaction. She barks at Ja

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wait a moment. We'll go inside in a moment. Nancy tries to calm her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to go back now, anyway. There are things we need to do inside. Ma pulls Jack to his feet. Jack risks a look at his grandparents. Robert looks down, can't look Jack in the e Ma notices Jack has taken his shoes off. She starts to fu with them, then gives up and lifts Jack into her arms to bring him inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma and Jack, still masked, walk through the hospital corr accompanied by A NURSE and a POLICE GUARD. Jack is fascin as they pass a nurses station, a man rolling a drip on a stand, the door to a day room where several patients sit playing cards, reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack lies on the bed listening to music on headphones. In background Ma talks to two DETECTIVES. They show her imag on a laptop which is turned away from Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack being weighed and measured.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jack getting his shots. Blood being taken. Jack is left with a little cotton swab fixed to this inner elbow with a thin band-aid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later. Quiet at last. Ma and Jack alone, shoes and masks Out of the big window as the last of the sun fades. Ma picks at something plain from their dinner tray, while Jack breastfeeds. In the background the TV news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which the major utility companies say they will not cover. Tenants' organizations have said they will fight this decision, if necessary at the federal level. Beat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now to developments in the case of the young woman, believed to be Joy Newsome, (a picture of a smiling Ma as a teenager comes on screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: who was rescued last night, along with her child, from a garden shed having allegedly been held captive there for over seven years. We are getting unconfirmed reports that an individual has just been arrested, after what one witness has called a 'short stand-off' at a house on the east side. Footage of Old Nick's house. The room phone starts to ring. Ma picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I'm watching it right now. I can't believe it. I just want to be home now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both victims are understood to be receiving medical attention at an unknown location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The child, of unknown gender, was described by one eyewitness as unable to walk ..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait a second. She switches off the set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma, Jack (masked, with sunglasses on), Nancy and Robert m towards the doors of the hospital where the Resident FBI agent waits for them. Robert is carrying the small bag th contains all of Ma and Jack's possessions. Ma puts her sunglasses on as they go through the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have your schedule of appointments, and your medications. Please completely finish the course of antibiotics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have my number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you need anything, if you just want to talk, you use it, alright? Ma nods. They pause at the doors until they're beckoned by FBI age

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ma accompanies Jack through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE and HOSPITAL SECURITY are outside along with FBI agents, a VICTIM LIASON person and Ma's LAWYER. As Jack again takes in the scale of the outside world the adults get caught in the logistics of who goes in which c who will take Ma's bag, what will happen at the other end the journey. Jack observes the little clusters of people their overlapping voices raised in clarification, reassurance... Ma and Jack are led to one of the waiting cars. Jack bump his head getting in. We watch the convoy pulling away from the hospital and ou into the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little later. Driving through a better, neater neighborhood than Old Nick's. Jack grips Ma's hand, watches the world pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been in the world nineteen hours. I've seen pancakes and stairs and a cat and windows and hundreds of cars and birds and police and doctors and Grandma and Grandpa, and persons with different faces and bigness and smells talking all at the same time. The world's like all TV planets on at the same time so I don't know which what to look and listen. Doors and doors and behind all the door there's another inside and another outside and things happen-happen- happening, it never stops. Plus the world's always changing brightness and hotness and there's invisible germs floating everywhere. When I was small I only knew small things but now I'm five I know everything.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She takes his mask off over his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn onto a residential street of low houses and wel groomed lawns. It's all familiar to Ma yet utterly strange: a crowd of m (national and international) is set up across the road fr her house behind temporary barricades. There are neighbor and well-wishers carrying helium balloons, flowers, toys, signs. POLICE keep order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Ma tidies her hair. Nancy, Robert and a LAWYER emerge from the first car. Nan manages an apologetic smile and half-wave to the neighbor who are watching from their own yards. RESIDENT AGENT leans in the driver's window to address Ma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready for this? Ma adjusts her shades and undoes her belt and Jack's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jack)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady - go. They climb out, heads down, shielded by FBI agents. Jack stumbles, almost falls. Now they're outside they can hear news helicopter overhead: it sounds like a war zone. Nanc joins them, taking Jack's hand, and they rush for the fro door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy! Joy! Any message for your well- wishers? What's it like to be home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack! Jack! Look this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack! How do you like the world so far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy! What do you say to your captor? Robert and the Lawyer approach the cluster of reporters b held back by the Police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this time ... excuse me, please ... at this time I will read a brief statement from the family after which I would ask you to respect their privacy. I'm sure you can understand this is a very - Nancy, Ma and Jack step into ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hallway of Nancy and Leo's house. The Resident Agent with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back of the property is well screened, and we've added to that where necessary, so if you keep these drapes closed you'll have complete privacy. We'll be right outside if there's anything at all you need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thank you so much. The Resident Agent leaves. Nancy, Ma and Jack stand in th stillness. Curtains drawn, lights on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My goodness. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you OK?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ma nods. From out of the kitchen comes an man in his late 50s. This is LEO, Nancy's partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home, honey. I'm very very happy to see you. He has tears in his eyes but he gives Ma her space, doesn move to embrace her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, this is Leo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there, sport. Jack takes in this new person. Nancy leads them through t the main room where the curtains to the back yard are ope

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I get you? Anyone hungry? We have everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People have been so kind. We won't use it all. Jack, would you like a drink? Jack sticks close to Ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, Grandma's asking if you'd like something to drink. Jack pulls her down to whisper in her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juice? (to Nancy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just some juice. I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming right up. Nancy disappears into the kitchen with Leo. Ma and Jack s on the sofa. Jack looks at cards and flowers arranged on table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're from people saying they're happy that we're safe and back home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just people. Ma, like Jack, speaks quietly. It's as if they were in a doctor's waiting room or a stranger's house trying to mak good impression. All so unreal. Ma gets up and looks out the window into the back yard. J follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's ice cream in the hammock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, what have you done with the hammock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the kitchen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it must be in the basement. Jack looking at his feet, sees a small dog toy on the flo He presses it with his foot. It squeaks, giving him a fri Nancy and Leo come in with loaded trays - juice, water cookies, cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just in case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. It's Leo's dog, Seamus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no. I've come to love Seamus. He's won me over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on furlough at the moment, with a pal of mine out of town. Living the country life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hospital said to avoid pets, until your immunity is back up ... and there's so much to take in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him he was a health hazard. Gotta sling your hook, buddy. He didn't take it too well. Silence. No one has any idea what to do next. We hear the front door open and close. Robert appears, he looks shake having taken questions from reporters. He looks for a sea chooses one far from Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You OK? He rubs his face, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawyer says they are expecting a plea but can't rule out a trial. He wants to get into everything, I said it could wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks most of the press will move on in a couple days. I made it clear there'd be no more contact, statements. To respect the family. Robert has to hide his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Jack watches, as Robert collects himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you a drink, Bob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, yes. I'd like that very much. Scotch... whatever you have.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. NANCY (to Ma)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything you'd like, or like to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Ma and Jack move towards the stairs. Ma carries a small b with their belongings. Nancy follows. At the foot of the stairs Jack stops. He's never had to climb stairs before. shows him how to grip the rail and he starts up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaching the top of the stairs, they walk the quiet, carp hallway. Jack takes it all in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma and Jack enter Ma's room. They absorb the decor of Ma' adolescence - preserved by her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your Mom's room, Jack. Jack looks around. He pulls a strand of his long hair out his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, maybe tomorrow we can cut that hair. What do you say, Jack? Jack shakes his head. Whispers to Ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack says that's where his `strong' is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah ha.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jack walks over to the bed and sits down. We are with him he takes in the band posters, track trophies, pictures - including pictures of his Mom as a young, happy girl. In background Nancy and Ma watch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll let you rest. We'll be downstairs. Before she leaves, Nancy talks quietly, insistently to Ma only catch fragments of what she's saying.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Conventional things, promising she is there, that there's nothing Ma can't say to her, how much she loves her. Ma i quiet, a little shell-shocked. Nancy leaves. Struck by the sight of her music keyboard, Ma tries it: d She kneels down, finds the plug and puts it in the outlet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't know I could play piano. Guess this tune... But after a few notes of 'Home on the Range'/'Big Rock Ca Mountain' she stumbles. Tries again, and messes it up. Stretches her stiff hand. Then she sits on the bed, sudde limp. Checks her watch. It's gone; an old habit. Both Ma Jack are subdued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long do we have to stay here? She takes out her bag of meds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting the tablets she needs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We live here now. She swallows her antibiotics and painkillers without wate She lies down. We stay on Jack's face as he continues to in his surroundings and digest what Ma has said. After a little while he lies beside her and lifts her shirt so he snuggle up and breastfeed. We repeat a sequence of shots from life before their esca ending in a mother & child portrait. In the little be they could be in Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma, with Jack pressed close to her, sits at the dining ta with Nancy, Robert and Leo. Desert. Jack is eating his fi bowl of ice-cream. He takes a big mouthful and holds his to his head. He tugs at Ma and she leans down so he can whisper to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering to Ma)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice cream hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a brain freeze there, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat it slower. Small talk as food is passed around. Ma puts her fork dow she is beginning to get upset. Nancy watches her, puts a on hers. After a little while Ma calms. They eat quietly, the adults aware of the complexity and strangeness of the situation. Jack, oblivious, chomps awa his ice-cream. Robert watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to turn in. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you in such a hurry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a long day. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't said one word to Jack. Unlike Ma, Nancy hasn't put two and two together about Robert's awkward bearing around Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy. Robert looks haunted, torn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have to talk about this now. From the carefulness and awkwardness of Robert's reply Na begins to understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Robert)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes we do. Look at him. Robert can't. Ma's anger deserts her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Jack is bewildered by this low-key catastrophe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, I can't... I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What that bastard did to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Bob. Let's all just give this a little time. Ma stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Jack. Time for bed. As Ma pulls Jack out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nancy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. I shouldn't be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack lies awake beside his sleeping mom. He hears footsteps. The door cracks open and a convoluted shadow appears, rimmed in light. The door opens wider and shadow resolves into Robert, watching his daughter and grandson sleep. Jack burrows into his pillow pretending t sleep. The door closes and soon he sleeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma and Nancy sit with coffees. Jack has some cereal. The house is very quiet. No one talks for a while. Eventually

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly to Ma)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Grandpa. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had to go home for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding Jack's face gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Jack, you want play with your new toys? Jack shakes his head. A few minutes later: Nancy is cleaning up in the kitchen Ma breastfeeds Jack. She looks out on the bare winter bac yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a chink in net curtains of a car pulling up outsi Nancy and Leo's house. The Lawyer gets out. We see that t press has thinned out substantially. There are a few curi MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC with nothing better to do, a UNIFOR POLICE OFFICER and a POLICE CAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack! Come away from there. We are in the lounge. Jack turns away from the window as Nancy goes to greet the Lawyer, keeping herself hidden as opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Automatic door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me take my shoes off here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LAWYER and Nancy watch Ma filling out some forms. She subdued. Jack has some blank paper in front of him. He is staring at a large open box of Crayola pencils; every sha of every color. He carefully selects 5 pencils - the 5 co he's used to from Room - and begins to draw. Jack occasionally glances at Leo, drawn by his natural warmth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other thing we need to talk about is coming up with some kind of media strategy. I know you're not thinking about that right now. But there's a lot to decide about in that category.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we're ready for talking yet. Not like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are certain to be expenses going forward and a prime time interview, one prime time interview, means a lot of money. Donations are coming - and I'll need some account details, better in yours than mine, right? - but it wouldn't amount to enough for, you know, open ended support. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's huge interest. Ma notices that Jack is using only the same small set of colors for his drawing that he had in Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, you have all those colors. Why don't you use them. You could draw a picture of Jack the giant slayer, with every color. Jack keeps drawing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma, Jack, Nancy and Leo eat supper, watching TV. Jack is drawn to look at Leo who does the old thumb trick for him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma is still asleep. Jack sits on the bed beside her, bore He looks towards the half-open door to the landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sits on the landing with a favorite toy from the pil the sitting room. From where he sits he can see the open to his and Ma's bedroom. It's dark inside. Eventually, Le walks into view with a male DETECTIVE and a female VICTIM LIASON OFFICER. He shows them to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you again.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He lets them out, closes the door behind them, then peeps through the closed curtains. As he turns away, he spots J gives him a salute and then busies himself in ways calcul to raise the interest of a 5-year-old. Tidying up, he pic up a ball from the floor, spins it on his finger, bounces Wanders off out of view, whistling, muttering about how particularly bouncy this ball is, etc. Jack starts down the stairs. He goes down on his backside yet confident enough to do it standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack wanders cautiously into the brightness of the living room, finding Leo who smiles at him, then gets back to whatever he's pretending to be doing. Jack is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Gee, am I hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pads into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see what we have here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack follows him in. Leo takes some cereal out of a well stocked cupboard, he opens the fridge for milk. Jack take all the produce it contains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Leo, at opposite ends of the counter, eat cereal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty good, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like this kind, too. Kind of sweet, but pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks at Leo, not answering, but not bolting. He kee eating. After a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a dog?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: This is the first time Jack has initiated any conversatio with an adult other than Ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. Named Seamus. He's very small. Not very smart. You'll have to meet him sometime. He'll shake your hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a dog called Lucky. But he's not real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Room. Leo takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever play catch, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Leo walk out into the garden. Jack is wearing hi hat and glasses but no sun-cream. The back yard is a simple rectangle of grass bounded by barkdust and shrubbery with a few small trees. But to Jac is a new cosmos. He wanders tentatively into the open spa Jack kneels to investigate the dirt and grass. He smells deeply. A little later, Leo and Jack throw the ball between them. Jack's shoes are irritating him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear what you're saying, but ... Leo drops the ball and kicks it to Jack who manages to ki it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've got their uses. Am I right? Jack nods. They play awhile, getting farther apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Jack and Leo look over. The NEIGHBOR BOY is standing at t fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a ball like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wary, but open)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kidding. It's a nice ball, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got mine for my birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantastic. You hear that, Jack? He got this same ball for his birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's he wearing those glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got sore eyes. The boy thinks about this. Decides it's an acceptable ans

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jack)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get that ball for your birthday? Jack shakes his head

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you get for your birthday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a truck but it broke and Ma got me a cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cake's not a present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's weird. A cake's just something to eat. No way is it a present. Jack looks at Leo and bursts into tears. He flees. Leo an the neighbor kid watch him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack runs through the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and slips into the bedroom where Ma is pacing around the house phone. She has a smart-phone in her hand which is trying to set up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma. Ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving Jack off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already gave all this information to the last person. (covering the mouthpiece)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is a cake a present?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? She turns away, deep in her own frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on ... I don't understand the words you are using, so why do you keep repeating them? (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have done that three times already. Jack sits quietly on the bed. Ma looks at him again, noti that his face is a little red. She covers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jack)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been outside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma opens the door of Leo's den. Jack is beside her, his f smeared with camomile lotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo, please don't ever take Jack outside again unless you know what you're doing. He can be seriously hurt by the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. It was overcast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has never had any UV. This is serious stuff, OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack gazes out the window, not wanting to go outside anym In the background, we can hear Ma noisily preparing somet in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma has boxes spread out all over the room. She is morbidl engrossed in some old papers and memorabilia. Jack sits down. She keeps reading, looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this. She shows him an old photo. Four girls in track uniforms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who that is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and Stacy Benton and Heather Noel and Laura Sullivan. That's how people did their hair. We were the relay team. I was the anchor. I was fast. We did track together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real track?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real track. On a field. We were fast. Best in the district. You know what happened to them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Nothing. They just lived and nothing happened. Look ... She picks up her old laptop from the floor by the bed. Sh has been looking through her friends pages on Facebook. S clicks on a couple of pages showing the same girls as the are now, then loses interest, closes the laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me more when you were young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't want to see any more. I don't want you to look at any more right now. Let's just be quiet for while. Okey dokey? They sit. She stands and paces the room, gnawing her lips wincing, trying and failing to keep her despair out of vi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack wakes from a nightmare with a start. No Ma beside hi He gets out of bed. The only light is coming from the hal through a crack in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma? He leaves the bedroom, stands blinking on the bright land He hears noises from downstairs, raised voices, a high pitched squeal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma? He goes downstairs. We follow him into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We enter with Jack to find Nancy, Leo and Ma. Ma and Nanc are hugging. The lawyer is on speaker phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all, we'll all sleep better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a good day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were gone! Ma turns. She's been crying but she comes over to Jack smiling broadly. She kneels so her face is level with his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to hear something really good? In the background Leo ends the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey listen. Old Nick is going to jail for a really long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know Old Nick is in jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now he'll be there for ever and ever. And I don't have to see him ever again or talk to the judge or any of those scary things. Isn't that great? Jack nods, not really understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can stop worrying now and start to do all the things we want. She picks him up and hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma is on her phone, furiously texting. Jack watches. He's bored. Just the sound of tapping thumbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking to people. She keeps texting, not explaining further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sits on the bed, watching Ma at her dressing table. is smartly dressed, her hair is fixed nicely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you look like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm dressed to go out, that's all. He watches MA force earrings through the healed piercings her ears. It looks painful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just some clothes and makeup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack follows Ma downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, we need to get you ready. We follow them into ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy cleans up in the kitchen. Ma and Jack come in. Ma f the sunscreen and starts to apply it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's too much for him right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not too much for me. I need to go out, get some air. Ma starts to apply sunscreen to Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nancy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could have a better attitude, you know. With some effort, Nancy holds her tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could support me in this. That's all I'm asking. I'm trying to take a step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to do it so soon. You could wait and we could go together. Ma wipes her hands, dials a number on her phone.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. STREET/LAURA'S CAR
dialogues.text: A car is waiting. Inside, a young woman smiles and waves. holding a booster seat - cracks the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! The girls hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look... Amazing. I can't believe you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fastening Jack)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've missed you so much. I can't believe you're actually here. And look at Jack! What a sweetheart! He is so cute! Ma gets into the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is too weird, sitting in this car right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are such an amazing person, Joy. I have thought about you so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I am so happy you are here with me now. I cannot even tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm happy, too. And a little freaked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just sit back. Relax. We'll take it nice and slow. We watch from the sidewalk as the car pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls talk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Tracy is doing so good. She got her teaching certificate and now she's teaching in Milwaukie, loving it. I saw her last summer and she is still so fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always liked her even though we never really hung out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She liked you too. (to Jack)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Mom was very popular in school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's actually not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you weren't popular, I don't know who was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan Torrey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true. The girls laugh. Laura's phone rings and she answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm driving. Something pert/flirtatious comes into her tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll just have to, won't you? She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just someone I met at work. Not serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What work do you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real estate. I mean I graduated Environmental Studies and I'm still super passionate about that - like what we're doing to this planet, but the whole property thing is exploding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car drifts around, eventually finds a spot. Ma, Jack Laura emerge. Jack is facing away from the mall. He is he by the big open view of the car park and road network bey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack. This way. Just hold my hand.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They start to walk towards the entrance. Ma stops and crouches down. Puts her hands on Jack's shoulders and spe tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to be fine. OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk through the whooshing doors of the mall and ste onto the ascending escalator. In the atrium, mobiles, banners, skylights. Teenagers, families, everyone scannin the myriad goods on display. At the top of the escalator sees a huge array of fruit and vegetables outside a supermarket. Further along, they pass a bookstore. Jack spots a displa new Dylan the Digger books. He grabs one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma, it's Dylan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't take that, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't belong to you. She takes the book from him and dumps it back in the disp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. If you're good we can get another book, a new one on our way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls cart Jack into the store among the hanging clot and mirrors. They tear through the racks. Techno music throbs. The mannequins leer. For a moment Jack loses track of the girls. The clothes a everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma! Ma! She reappears from behind a rack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here. OK? Just calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was scared!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doing her best to be reassuring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be. This is normal. This is what people do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember your superpowers, alright, have fun. And no whining, OK? A clerk appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, there. Anything I can help you with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need some... (she looks around desperately)... some shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Shoes are all over there. Just let me know if you need anything else, okay? Ma goes and stares at the shoe display. Many colors, many styles. She's paralysed. Jack is close beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we get Dylan now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These ones are kind of cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I definitely don't want any of these. I'd never wear these. She grabs Jack's hand and drags him out of the store. Lau follows looking weirded-out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trio hurries through the mall. Ma looks nervous, Laur concerned, Jack bewildered and angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely paying attention)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hungry, Jack? You want something in the food court? They've got, I don't know, pizza and stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want Dylan. You said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said if you were good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could run and get it for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I said no, so he has to understand. They pass a Cinnabon outlet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, you want a Cinnabon? You smell that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cinnabon is good. You might like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should just go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want Dylan. I want Dylan now.You said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are being really naughty Jack. Jack starts into a full on tantrum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suit yourself. She grabs him to carry him out, but he pulls away. All th noise has drawn the attention of the people around them. couple of TEENAGERS approach Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jack)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, are you that kid from the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck away from him. Get the fuck away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma, Jack and Laura clamber into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Oh. My. God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, shit, shit. Those assholes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buckle up, Jack, all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around, not knowing what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. Just buckle it, all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans over the seat and jerks the buckle on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how it works, all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like you in the world!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well maybe I don't like you either!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura pauses, Ma glowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily to Laura) Just go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura backs out of the parking spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sits with Nancy and Leo in the quiet room, playing Candyland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you got me on that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys want to start again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They set up the board again. Nancy spins the dial and mov her figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go. My turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, it can be tough to be a Mom. Sometimes it's really tough, and you can get angry, but it doesn't mean you don't love your baby. Jack takes his turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sits with Dr. Mittal. After a little while, Nancy co in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Dr. Mittal stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Let her rest. I'll see you again next week, Jack. Mittal and Nancy leave. Jack hears them talking quietly i the hall. Nancy describing Ma's behavior, sharing her worries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sits on the floor beside the bed watching Dora on Nancy's smart phone. Ma's who's been dozing sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack. Please turn that off. Jack keeps watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now. I mean it. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to watch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack! Please. Please. I'm begging you, please turn that off. Jack looks at her. She is twisted in pain at the sound of show. Jack switches it off.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It reminds me too much of Room. I can't have it.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jack ignores her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got so many other things to play with. You should try something else. He won't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Let's look at all your stuff. She drags him down to the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to a pile of boxes in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at all these toys. Most kids would love that stuff. You've barely even looked at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Jack. He shuffles to the pile. Ma crouches - finds and rips ope box of Lego.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pretty cool, right? You like it? Nancy steps in beside her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs something real to do. I'm getting worried about him with the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give him my phone so please don't give him yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want him to connect to something. You know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's really doing fine. Ma's aggression deserts her. She is distressed, afraid. S screws up her face, hides it in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I don't know what's happening to me. I can't feel anything. Even for ... Her hand flings towards Jack. She chokes her words back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't judge me. You have no right. People walk around like the world is fine and normal but it's not. Nancy tries to put her hand on Ma's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't! I can't bear it. I thought this would be heaven, but it's worse. Can you understand that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just need to rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recovering, closing the crack of vulnerability)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I don't! That's not what I need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what the Doctor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wiping away tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! That's not what he said. You don't know what he said. That's confidential and you don't even know. Just forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like you're impossible to talk to right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you know what's in my head. Trust me, you couldn't handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me and see. I've asked you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're seeing that every time you look at me? Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my daughter, that's what I'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well you seemed to get on OK without me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you say that? You think you're the only one whose life was destroyed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, that's exactly what I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you feel if somebody took Jack from you? MA                               LEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.                         Go easy. Jack puts his hands over his ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at him. You should be thinking about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you ever tell me how to look after my son. I'm sorry if I'm not `nice' enough for you. Maybe if you hadn't been in my head saying `be nice' that day I wouldn't have gone to help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy is horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (storming out) This isn't even my house anymore. I don't know what this is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma leaves.    Jack shakes his head. Holds back tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy moves to hug him but she sees Jack stiffen and she stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack wanders the back yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack wanders in. Ma is sitting on the bed. She seems calm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, Jack. He goes over and she wraps her arms around him. He cuddle into her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Jack, we're going to have to move away from here someday. We're going to have to get our own house. And a yard. We're going to have to do all kinds of things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cube vans rolling up. He sees a woman, slick, driven, 50s out of an SUV. This is the Hostess, the same one we saw o in Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is fascinated by the machinery. The boxes, cords, tripods and lights. He stands near the camera crew, listening to them talk, watching them set up their gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, looking through the back window, watches the camera crew follow his mom and the hostess around the yard. They pretend to talk. Ma is dressed in her best outfit. Nancy approaches Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time for you to go upstairs, Jack. Remember what your Mom said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is quiet apart from two muffled voices. Jack lo over to see Leo asleep in a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack creeps out of the room and down the hall. He walks d the stairs - gingerly, but on his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack edges into the living room, finding an enthralling circle of lights and cameras focussed on his mother and t hostess in their chairs. The center of the room is shadowless and ultra-vivid, exp by many bounces and fills. Ma and the Hostess face each o in two armchairs brought in for the occasion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are an amazing, inspiring, courageous, beautiful young woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know all our viewers are amazed by the intelligence and poise and endurance and inner strength you displayed during your ordeal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truly, an amazing test of character.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thank you so much. I hope they all know how much their thoughts and prayers have meant the last few weeks. To our whole family. Jack is enthralled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Jack. Your son. By all accounts he is a normal, high-functioning, happy little boy. Amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is. He's my life. I never could have survived without him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made life as normal and nurturing as you could given the environment. You gave him a childhood. How did you manage to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I didn't think about it. I didn't plan it. When I found out I was pregnant with Jack, it just seemed like a terrible joke. You know? To bring someone into that place, it just seemed so wrong. I was in a very scary frame of mind. I thought the devil was controlling my life. In a way he was. Ma makes an effort to control her emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interjecting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting the feeling my client needs to - Without taking her eyes off Ma, the Hostess holds her pal out to the lawyer. Her tone is brusque, matter of fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, everything was different once Jack came, because he was so beautiful and I had to keep him safe. Ma, calmer, pulling herself together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he's older will you talk to him about his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's not his. The Hostess thinks she's getting an astonishing scoop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon, are you -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A father's a man who loves his kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So true, in a very real sense, but the genetic relationship -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not a relationship. Jack's nobody's but mine. The Hostess decides to change tack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You breastfed Jack for five years - in fact, viewers may be startled to learn that you still do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this whole story, that's the shocking detail? The hostess looks over a a colleague, down at her notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did it ever occur to you to ask your captor to take Jack away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To leave him outside a hospital, say, so he'd be found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Jack could be free. The ultimate sacrifice, of course, but for him to have a normal childhood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had me. She starts to stand, dragging her mic pack with her. The lawyer steps in. Chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later. Hushed. Jack eating at the table. Leo reads the sports pages nearby, a silent companion. Jack can hear Ma, in the lounge, talking low to Nancy. He recognizes low sobs: Ma is crying. Jack stops eating halfway through a mouthful, can't swall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night. Jack wakes, sensing himself alone. No Ma in the be he touches the mark her body's left. No Ma in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks on tiptoe down the landing. The last door is the bathroom, and there's a crack of lig Jack taps very quietly on the door, remembering the rule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma? He goes to the top of the stairs and considers descending Then he creeps back to the bathroom, whispers a bit loude

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He tries the handle, but the door opens only a few inches Frightened he starts to bang on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma! Ma! An adult torso, Leo's, comes into the frame, driving with full force against the door which gives a little. Jack pu his face to the gap and sees Ma's hair spread out on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little later. Jack gets glimpses of chaos: on the bathr floor, TWO PARAMEDICS working on Ma (who responds just en that we know she's not dead), Nancy in the bathroom doorw Leo trying to calm her. But no sound.   It's as if Jack has been deafened by an explosion. Later: as Ma is carried out in the background, Jack sits the floor. We push in on him; he is hypnotized by the flashing ambulance lights on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's so much of place in the world, there's less time because the time has to be spread extra thin over all the places like butter, so all the persons say hurry up, let's get going, pick up the pace, finish up now. Ma was in a hurry to go boing up to heaven but she forgot me, Dumbo Ma, so the aliens threw her back down craaaaaaaash and broke her. Next morning. Jack in a ball on the bed. He opens his fis Bad Tooth, all he has of Ma. In the background we hear the phone ringing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from hallway)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, come here. It's for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack arrives. Leo holds out the phone. A pause then Jack takes it, holds it too far away: his first call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Jack. I've got someone who wants to talk to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he there? Put him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on. He's waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma? She struggles to get control of her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you doing OK? Jack is stumped by this question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (louder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could. I just need to -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pick. I pick for both of us.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ma breaks down in sobs. Jack hands the phone to Leo who talks to Nancy in murmurs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sits in the space under the roof in Ma's bedroom pla with Lego.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack watches TV with Nancy and Leo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack mopes around the house. Nancy and Leo give him space

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack wakes up alone. Minutes later we see him enter Ma's walk-in closet. Sound things being shifted around inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks out to the landing with Ma's box of memorabili Moments later, journals and photos are spread around him. examines her year-books, photos of her as a child his own age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A week has passed and the outside of the house is complet clear of press/onlookers. Nancy's car pulls up. She get's out, let's Jack out of the back seat and the two of them carry shopping bags to the front door. A NEIGHBOR waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been shopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes we have. We're making cupcakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy and Jack bake companionably in the kitchen. Jack st on a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how to beat eggs, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. I did it before. In Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you? Wow. What else did you do there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of things. I miss it sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't it awfully small. Jack shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh uh, it went every direction all the way to the end. It never finished. And Ma was always there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was small in wardrobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do in wardrobe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep. When Old Nick came. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see Ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. She just needs to be on her own a little while. We hear the front door closing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Jack. There's someone here who'd like to meet you. Jack hops down from his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks out into the hallway and stops dead. Leo is standing there holding a small terrier dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, meet Seamus. Would you like to pet him? Jack approaches cautiously, reaches a hand gingerly to pe the dog, withdraws, reaches again and pets him. Nancy app in the background. Jack sees her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could just go in and tell her about Seamus. Only for a minute. Or I could just look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let's get this guy some air after being all stuffed up in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack tentatively climbs on a frame in a playground. Leo watches, with Seamus on a leash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy is reading. Jack enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need the scissors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For cutting my hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really want to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to send it to Ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She needs my strong more than me. So I want to send it to her. Or you could take it to her. Nancy is moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can help you if you'd like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Let's do this right. I've wanted to cut that hair a very long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sits in a chair with a sheet around his neck. Nancy clips his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to cut your mother's hair all the time. And your Grandpa's hair. I've still got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think this will work? Can my strong be her strong too? I'm not really sure if it works that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it does. We all help each other stay strong. No one is strong alone. You and your mom, you help each other through, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you and me. And you and Leo. And Leo and me. We all have the same strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, here goes. Jack closes his eyes as Nancy cuts off his pony tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is leaning his head back on the round lip of the bathroom sink. She turns on the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now lean back. The water is nicely warm now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the best part. She pours water over his head, and shampoos him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feels good, doesn't it? He closes his eyes and nods. She pours more water. And mo His face is rosy with the heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Grandma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is drawing a multicolored picture. He uses all the colors of the crayon box. The picture of a house grows in colors and dimensions. Th door is green. The windows orange. The roof red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack plays with the Neighbor Boy and Seamus in the garden hears a tap tap tap and looks round. Ma is watching him through the glass back door. He runs to her as she opens door. They greet each other with nervous joy, without wor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Ma sit beside each other on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you better now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starting to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She strokes his short hair then reaches into her bag and takes out his ponytail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll always keep this with me, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will never, ever let it go. When Grandma brought it to me, I... I knew I could get well. You saved me. Again. They sit placidly a moment. He reaches for her shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. There's none left. Jack think for a bit, accepts the new situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a good enough Ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're Ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. She puts her arm around him. They sit in a gentle silence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to play with Aaron now. He's my friend. Ma hugs him hard before he leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma and Jack look out to sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was four I didn't even know about the world and now me and Ma are going to live in it forever and ever till we're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma and Jack water their new African Violet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a street in a city in a country called America on the earth that's a blue and green planet always spinning so I don't know why we don't fall off. Then there's Outer Space, and nobody knows where's heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma and Nancy are curled up together on the sofa. Leo is there, too. The adults laugh as Jack fools around with Seamus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma and Jack are parked outside a Mom & Pop Burger Joi eat in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma and I have decided that because we don't know what we like we get to try everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Ma walk in the darkness through quiet suburban streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma and Jack sit in a hammock in the back yard. The weathe turning warmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have so many things to do. Flying in an airplane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely. Making new friends. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we go back to Room? Ma looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just for a visit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A police car pulls up outside Old Nick's. Jack, Ma and Officer Parker get out. They stare at the house, still surrounded by crime-scene tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow me, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car port is now sealed off and the only way out back through the house. Jack follows Ma and Officer Parker ins It's tidy (except for a desk ransacked by police), anonymously banal: a leather suite, a cross-trainer, a fl screen TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step out into the back yard. Jack's gaze moves to th grey shed. A double-take: it's Room. With an enormous bulldozer beside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan! Ma heads for the shed, Jack right behind her. Officer Parker stands nearby. There's a MALE OFFICER ther also, guarding the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step in. Drawings stripped off the walls, furniture shifted: the magic's gone. Jack stares and sniffs the air

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't Room. Has it gotten shrinked? Our friends...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taken away for evidence. (explaining)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proof that we were here. Jack retraces their track marks around the bed. He draws in the fingerprint powder on the table. Their Plant is all shrivelled. Jack strokes it. Under the bed, he finds Eggsnake; touches the needle tong He comes back to the doorway, where Ma stands frozen. He measures his height with his hand: an inch over the 5. He hears bird song from the yard; patter of rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's because Door's open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't really be Room if Door's open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you - would you like it closed? Jack shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go now. Is there... anything you need? Jack looks around at the detritus of his childhood. Then walks to the wall behind the bed and pats it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack - He goes around Room fast, whispering his bye-byes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Jack. He looks up at the skylight, rain running down it. He cli onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye-bye. (to Ma)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say bye-bye to Room. Ma says it but on mute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crane up as Jack and Ma emerge from the shed, hand in han and walk away without looking back.
